subject: Design
title: The Desktop Metaphor: Files, Folders, and Trash
description: One-minute skill: The Desktop Metaphor: Files, Folders, and Trash.

hook.text: Your computer desktop has files, folders, and a trash can. None of these exist â€” they're metaphors.

buildup.text: In the 1980s, designers chose an office desk as the model. People already knew how desks worked.

discovery.text: The metaphor let novices transfer real-world knowledge to a completely new digital environment.

twist.text: The metaphor worked so well that people now organize real desks to look like their digital ones.

climax.text: Forty years later, we still use folders even though computers don't need them.

punchline.text: The best interface borrows from what people already know.

quiz.question: Why was the desktop metaphor so effective?
